intro: Euclea mayottensis, commonly known as Mayotte woodbine, is a climbing shrub native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
